description: A legendary sky island located 10,000 meters above the Blue Sea, made entirely of clouds. Skypiea is composed of Angel Island (residential area) and Upper Yard (forbidden territory). The island uses unique dial technology and is ruled by a figure known as God.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Skypiea
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates successfully reach the legendary sky island of Skypiea after their harrowing journey up the Knock Up Stream and through the Milky Road.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the crew's entry into one of the most unique and important locations in One Piece, beginning the Skypiea Arc proper.

keyEvents.title: Scientific Explanation of Skypiea
keyEvents.description: Pagaya explains how Skypiea exists through the interaction of pyrobloin (from seastone) with water vapor, creating the Sea Clouds and Island Clouds that form the sky islands.
keyEvents.significance: Provides scientific grounding for the existence of sky islands within One Piece's world.

statusHistory.reason: Skypiea is inhabited and functioning as a civilization under God's rule

description: A beautiful beach on Angel Island in Skypiea where the cloud sea meets the island clouds. This peaceful location is where the Straw Hats first land and meet the Skypiean residents Conis and Pagaya.

keyEvents.title: Landing at Angel Beach
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates land at Angel Beach, their entry point to Skypiea, where they marvel at the fluffy clouds and strange environment.
keyEvents.significance: The starting point of the crew's Skypiea adventure and their first safe haven in the sky.

keyEvents.title: Meeting Conis at Angel Beach
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats meet Conis playing her harp on Angel Beach, beginning their first friendly interaction with a Skypiean.
keyEvents.significance: Angel Beach serves as the welcoming entry point where the crew makes their first local friends.

keyEvents.title: Nami Masters Waver Riding
keyEvents.description: Nami demonstrates exceptional skill riding a waver across the cloud sea at Angel Beach, impressing even the experienced Pagaya.
keyEvents.significance: Angel Beach becomes the training ground where Nami discovers her natural aptitude for waver riding.

statusHistory.reason: Angel Beach is a peaceful, inhabited area of Skypiea

description: A forbidden territory in Skypiea where God resides. Entry is strictly prohibited under penalty of death. The area contains the mysterious ancient land that holds secrets of Skypiea's past and the source of conflict between God and the Shandians.

keyEvents.title: Warning About Upper Yard
keyEvents.description: Conis and Pagaya gravely warn the Straw Hats that Upper Yard is forbidden territory where God resides, and that no one may enter under any circumstances.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Upper Yard as the central forbidden location and source of conflict in the Skypiea Arc.

keyEvents.title: Nami Reaches Upper Yard's Edge
keyEvents.description: While riding the waver, Nami unknowingly arrives at the edge of Upper Yard and comments on its impressive size, unaware of the danger.
keyEvents.significance: Creates immediate tension as the crew inadvertently approaches the forbidden zone.

statusHistory.reason: Upper Yard is controlled by God and entry is forbidden under penalty of death

description: The home of Pagaya and Conis on Angel Island. This house serves as a gathering place where the Straw Hats learn about dial technology, cloud formation, and the rules of Skypiea from their gracious hosts.

keyEvents.title: Learning About Dials
keyEvents.description: Inside Pagaya's house, the Straw Hats receive detailed explanations about dial technology and see demonstrations of how these unique shells work.
keyEvents.significance: Pagaya's house becomes an educational setting where crucial information about Skypiean culture and technology is shared.

keyEvents.title: Explanation of Clouds and Pyrobloin
keyEvents.description: At his house, Pagaya explains the scientific basis for Skypiea's clouds to the curious Straw Hats, particularly Robin and Nami.
keyEvents.significance: The house serves as a classroom for understanding the unique physics of the sky islands.

statusHistory.reason: Pagaya's house is an inhabited residence
